FuncDef:
The user-group-case-sensitive enable command enables the device to support case-sensitive user group names.
The undo user-group-case-sensitive enable command disables the device from supporting case-sensitive user group names.
By default, the device supports case-insensitive user group names and considers all upper-case characters as lower-case ones.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To allow the NE40E to support case-sensitive user group names that some RADIUS servers deliver, run the user-group-case-sensitive enable command.
Configuration Impact
The undo user-group-case-sensitive enable command will be invalid if two user group names have the same characters but different cases or a user group name contains both upper and lower cases.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
